intro: Erythranthe nudata, commonly known as the nakedleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its flowers have four petals and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and moths. Erythranthe nudata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
